org.cripac.isee.pedestrian.tracking

Class Tracklet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cripac.isee.pedestrian.tracking.Tracklet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Tracklet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    The Tracklet class stores a sequence of bounding boxes, representing the track of a pedestrian in a video.

    TODO Should assign an IDRANK to each track or use some other methods to identify them.

    Author:
    Ken Yu, CRIPAC, 2016
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Identifier of a tracklet.

    • Field Detail

      • id

        public Tracklet.Identifier id
        The identifier of the track.

      • numTracklets

        public int numTracklets
        The total number of tracklets in the video. This field can be left as -1, meaning that this information is not available yet, but setting this field can help checking whether all tracklets have been obtained or processed in latter steps. So it is highly recommended that track generators should also fill in this field.

      • startFrameIndex

        public int startFrameIndex
        The starting frame index of this track in the source video. User can use this to calculate the starting time of this track using the FPS information of the video. Its default value is -1, meaning the index has not been determined yet.

      • locationSequence

        public Tracklet.BoundingBox[] locationSequence
        A sequence of locations (as a form of BoundingBox) of the pedestrian at each moment in the tracklet.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Transform this tracklet to Json string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a json string of this tracklet.

      • sample

        public void sample(int numSamples)
        Select some bounding boxes as the appearance samples of the pedestrian. Only these bounding boxes retain the patch data, and patch data in other bounding boxes will be cleared, so as the tracklet consumes less memory.
        Parameters:
        numSamples - number of samples to be selected.

      • getSamples

        public java.util.Collection<Tracklet.BoundingBox> getSamples()
